think_procedure: To determine if the 'track_activities' knob in PostgreSQL is a 'special knob', first understand the function of the knob. The 'track_activities' knob enables tracking of the activities of each SQL statement executed by a server session. It is a Boolean type setting, typically set to ON or OFF (true or false in configuration files). Next, check if there are any special values like -1 or 0 that alter its typical boolean behavior. Since 'track_activities' only accepts true or false and doesn't have an alternate special value that changes its behavior fundamentally (like disabling or enabling a completely different feature), it operates as a regular boolean knob without special values.
